title: Splat Charger CAM-O
content:
The Splat Charger CAM-O is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is a Barazushi-branded variant of the the Splat Charger from the Splatlands Collection and features a different sub and special weapon.

- 1 Appearance

- 2 Splatoon 3

2.2 Quotes

The Splat Charger CAM-O makes its first appearance in Splatoon 3 with identical stats to the Splat Charger.

- The Splat Charger CAM-O is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 26. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- Ink consumption scales from 2.25% to 18% depending on the charge level.
The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The Splat Charger CAM-O can store its charge while submerged in ink.
A stored charge can be held for up to 1.25 seconds (75 frames).

- A stored charge can be held for up to 1.25 seconds (75 frames).

- The Splat Charger CAM-O can only store its charge if the weapon is fully charged.
The delay between being submerged in ink with a stored charge and being able to fire the charge is 31 frames.
The delay between being submerged in ink with a stored charge and the laser appearing is 25 frames.

- The delay between being submerged in ink with a stored charge and being able to fire the charge is 31 frames.

- The delay between being submerged in ink with a stored charge and the laser appearing is 25 frames.

- It takes 1 second to fully charge the weapon (60 frames).
When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.
When charging a shot while in the air, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.
The weapon must charge for at least 8 frames before it can release its charge.

- When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- When charging a shot while in the air, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- The weapon must charge for at least 8 frames before it can release its charge.

- The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- A stored charge can be held for up to 1.25 seconds (75 frames).

- The delay between being submerged in ink with a stored charge and being able to fire the charge is 31 frames.

- The delay between being submerged in ink with a stored charge and the laser appearing is 25 frames.

- When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- When charging a shot while in the air, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- The weapon must charge for at least 8 frames before it can release its charge.

- The interval between firing and being able to submerge in ink is 15 frames.

- Fully charged shots will  pierce opponents.

- When charging while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.02 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 20 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Damage scales from 40 to 80 depending on the charge level. At full charge, the damage is 160.

- Shot distance scales from 10.75 units to 25.75 units depending on the charge level.
The range of charger weapons is impacted by the position of the weapon's muzzle in its model file. These range numbers account for this variation.

- The range of charger weapons is impacted by the position of the weapon's muzzle in its model file. These range numbers account for this variation.

- The range of charger weapons is impacted by the position of the weapon's muzzle in its model file. These range numbers account for this variation.

[1][2]

If a Splat Charger is a sniper rifle at heart, then the Splat Charger CAM-O from Barazushi is a natural evolution. Its earthy tones and matte texture help it blend into the background. Here, it comes with the Sprinkler sub, which can be used to lure enemies out of hiding for easy splatting. Add the Crab Tank special, and you've got something, well, special. Overall, the loadout is a tactician's dream. I recommend it to any player who thinks of the battlefield like a chessboard.

Promotional video (link to file)

- The Splat Charger CAM-O's appearance could be a reference to the Kelp Splat Charger, given the kelp stuck to the side of the ink tank.

The brand stylization suffix "CAM-O" could be interpreted as camo or camouflage.
